info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 4:02PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL REEVES AND NORTHWESTERN WARD COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM CDT... At 402 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Toyah, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Pecos, Toyah, Barstow, Verhalen, Toyah Lake, and Pecos Municipal Airport. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 22 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
